intro: Agrestis verticillata, commonly known as the whorled agrestis, is a flowering plant belonging to the Asteraceae family. It is characterized by its basal rosette of narrow, grass-like leaves and clusters of small, yellowish flowers arranged in a whorled pattern. Native to temperate regions of Europe and Asia, it thrives in meadows and disturbed soils. The plant is often found in open habitats and is known for its ability to spread through both seeds and rhizomes. Its botanical features make it an important component of biodiversity in its native ecosystems.
